title: Attacker with an Old account might still be able to DoS ctf.hacker101.com by sending a Crafted request

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:** by sending a crafted request on ctf.hacker101.com a very long delay with a response of error 502 has been observed I suspect that if I made this request on multiple tabs on my browser concurrently, it may cause ctf.hacker101.com to crash thats why I haven't tried it. **Description:** By changing "accept encoding" and "user agent" headers, and sending a crafted request to ctf.hacker101.com a very long delay along with the response of error 502 has been observed. ###Request Used ### ``` GET /group HTTP/1.1 Host: ctf.hacker101.com User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; ONEPLUS A6000) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/81.0.4044.117 Mobile Safari/537.36 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, gzip,deflate,br Referer: https://ctf.hacker101.com/group Connection: close Cookie: ███████ Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1 ``` ###Response Recieved### (after delay of 46 Seconds) ``` HTTP/1.1 502 Bad Gateway Date: Tue, 28 Apr 2020 07:18:17 GMT Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Connection: close Set-Cookie: ███ Set-Cookie: cf_use_ob=443; path=/; expires=Tue, 28-Apr-20 07:18:47 GMT Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:01 GMT Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate, post-check=0, pre-check=0 Pragma: no-cache X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN CF-RAY: ███ Server: cloudflare cf-request-id: ███ Content-Length: 4140 ctf.hacker101.com | 502: Bad gateway

Error 502 Ray ID: 58af01057a3bdf57 • 2020-04-28 07:18:17 UTC

Bad gateway

You

Browser

Working
Mumbai

Cloudflare

Working
ctf.hacker101.com

Host

Error

What happened?

The web server reported a bad gateway error.

What can I do?

Please try again in a few minutes.

Cloudflare Ray ID: 58af01057a3bdf57 • Your IP: 182.70.148.191 • Performance & security by Cloudflare

``` ### Steps To Reproduce 1. open ctf.hacker101.com. 2. login to a test account . 3. you can use my account as well , 4. NOTE: I think number of groups the test user has created should be alot (like i have around 3000+ ). 5. send the request I have pasted above with the same crafted headers . 6.observe the long delay of around 40-50 seconds and the 502 response . 7.note that if this request is sent multiple times the sever can crash (but i haven't tried it , because i am trying to practice safe testing) Thank you ### Optional: Your Environment (Browser version, Device, etc) * ### Optional: Supporting Material/References (Screenshots) * ### Optional: Did you use [recon data made available by HackerOne](https://github.com/Hacker0x01/helpful-recon-data) to find this vulnerability? yes/no ## Impact attacker can dos ctf.hacker101.com they just require an old account with nice number of groups (like mine ) Note: I stopped immediately when I observed the delay and response 502 ,I am pretty sure I can dos it even without intruder and just by opening multiple tabs in browser . but I haven't tried it yet because I am trying to improve myself and practice safe testing thank you

activities.message:
Hi @iamr000t,

Thank you for your submission. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Kind regards,
@glassofbeer

>>When you say a crafted request, what were the changes you made to your request that triggered the issue? You mentioned that you tampered with 2 headers, but what where the changes you made?

I tampered values of user agent header and accept-encoding header with these. 
```
Accept-Encoding: gzip, gzip,deflate,br
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; ONEPLUS A6000) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/81.0.4044.117 Mobile Safari/537.36
```
i did this because yesterday i noticed i was able to load the page successfully with my laptop with a 200 response 
but opening it in my android cellphone's chrome browser it resulted in a 502 error with long delay. 


>>Also, have you validated if those 2 changes in the headers where the cause of the issue? Can you please provide the full, raw original HTTP request?

###I believe minorly the headers and majorly the long response from the server due to the high numbers of groups that have been created from my account in the past are the cause of this issue.###

also, I think there have been some changes from yesterday to today  ie :
yesterday I had to tamper the headers, to make the server respond with 502 without headers otherwise the page was loading successfully with a 200 response with the original request 
but today it seems like even if I send the normal original request the server responds with a 502, 

###I am pretty sure this issue can be very easily exploited and cause a DoS attack on hacker101 

###I am pasting below the original raw request

```
GET /group HTTP/1.1
Host: ctf.hacker101.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://ctf.hacker101.com/ctf
Connection: close
Cookie: ████████
Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1

```
Any updates?
@glassofbeer hello, can you triage this now?

@iamr000t

Sorry for the delay on this. I've tampered with the request and added the same headers you provided:

```http
Accept-Encoding: gzip, gzip,deflate,br
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 10; ONEPLUS A6000) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/81.0.4044.117 Mobile Safari/537.36
```

But that did not cause any change in the response time. Actually, it resulted in the response arriving 100 milliseconds faster..

Can you please double check and advise?

@glassofbeer , for reproducing this issue you would need to use my account because the number of groups created by the user should be a lot (for example I have around 3000+ groups created on ctf.hacker101.com , what happened is HackerOne fixed the limit of groups a user can create on hacker101 , but the obvious thing they forgot about is the high number of groups an old account may already have (for example my account), if we summarize this issue then it looks like 

My account has a lot of groups on ctf.hacker101 & a lot of groups = a lot of delay on the response  + long response & a lot of delay+long response = 502 on ctf.hacker101 and DoS on hacker101 



**please watch the video**
I have attached to demonstrate how easily I can make ctf.hacker101.com time out by simply opening multiple tabs please spare some of your valuable time and have a look at the video 
also note that no headers were used in the creation of the video and this simply happened because I have a lot of groups already created in bulk on hacker101 . 

and note that : i am being very careful and practicing safe testing thats why i will not use intruder or alot of tabs because it might actually DoS the site.
@glassofbeer did you checked the video i have attached?
any updates will be appreciated, thank you

@iamr000t

Sorry for the delay on this.

Are you able to demonstrate that the behavior affects other users and not only yours? I mean, if you login with 2 separate accounts on 2 different browsers, send the 3 request for the user with the hundreds of groups and trigger the delay, immediately move to the other browser and try to navigate it...will it affect that user as well?

Otherwise, if you try just with that single account, this would be a self-exploitation scenario with no significant security impact.

@glassofbeer the website would have gotten down showing every user error response code of 502 if i had opened 10 tabs instead of 3 :) , yes i can demonstrate that with multiple accounts and multiple browser as well , i am 1 10 percent sure , this will affect other users as well . please let me know if any more information/action from my side is required .
thank you
Hi @iamr000t - I'm discussing this submission internally with the HackerOne team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

@glassofbeer are there any updates yet? 
Thanks you

hey @glassofbeer are there any updates yet , can we triage this ? 
thank you
Hi @iamr000t - We are still looking into this report and will update you when we have additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!
But this be at least triaged by now?

@lasagna @glassofbeer  :)  
I am waiting for a response ,it has been 20 days since my initial report and you guys haven't even triaged this yet :-O 
can i please get an appropriate reason why this triage is taking so much time ?  
i mean  its an easy vulnerability , i submitted the video and every please let me know whats wrong . 
thank you .

I still can seem to understand what's going on. I've done tests while changing the headers and that doesn't seem to do anything. I suspect it's all the groups in your account, however, it being paginated to 25 groups doesn't make sense to slow it down to timeout.

Your video doesn't load for me, can you try to upload it again?

I'll change this to triage in the meantime.

Thanks a lot , for the response .
i am attaching the same video again .
yes i am pretty sure high number of groups are the cause .


> I suspect it's all the groups in your account, however, it being paginated to 25 groups doesn't make sense to slow it down to timeout.

there are two interesting things which I highly suspect are responsible for this issue . 

###1.)I highly doubt that the backend dbms query is not properly implemented 
can you make sure while querying group info  proper limit is enforced For example=> LIMIT 0, 25
And all the groups i have created are not being queried in a single page load ? i believe this can be a strong reason for for this issue . 
because if we query large records , it will definitely make page to load slower and eventually result in dos . 
 

###2.)Improper pagination:
If you watch the video 
you will notice a funny thing that the group count was indeed 25 how ever , the pages count was exceeded to 3000+  . so i think code used here can be optimised further ie to show page numbers 0 to 10 then 10 to 20 when navigates to 10th page number (i think this will be an ideal fontend pagination ) .

thank you .

Video still doesn't seem to be working...

We've recently added some indices on the database, can you test again to see if you still have performance issues?

I can verify the behaviour is still the same and not fixed, ie " /group" endpoint takes a long time to load and 502 response, multiple tabs will cause DoS ,
Regarding the video , 
i have used ███████████████ 
███ █████████(███  ███████)██████ which i can share the video ? 
maybe youtube or something please let me know, meanwhile i will try to convert the video in all possible formats . 
Thank you
this video should work perfectly

@iamr000t the video works! Thanks for showing that, it was helpful to see how slow the endpoint really was.

I believe, as you suspected, this was an incomplete fix. I've deployed a new version, can you verify if you are seeing improved performance?

This seems to be completely fixed now, response time is improved significantly and opening multiple tabs concurrently also didn't cause the server to timeout.

I am curious to know what code exactly caused this behavior, and what steps were taken to mitigate this, as I am planning to recreate this on my local machine and it would also really help in my research regarding DoS attacks if you can share any type of information that will be great. 

I also would like to ask if this report is eligible for a bounty & swag.
I am really trying hard to improve my DoS testing methodologies and I believe I followed the best practices of testing for DoS, while finding and reporting this issue
Thank you.

> I am curious to know what code exactly caused this behavior, and what steps were taken to mitigate this, as I am planning to recreate this on my local machine and it would also really help in my research regarding DoS attacks if you can share any type of information that will be great. The problem existed in our usage of a library and our inability to effectively test the behavior. The library we choose to use is (SQLAlchemy-Paginator)[https://pypi.org/project/SQLAlchemy-Paginator/] and we leveraged their examples to generate the pagination footer (Example1 in their documentation): ```python {%- for page in pagination.paginator %} {% if pagination.number == page.number %}
  • {{ page.number }} (current)
    • {% else %}
  • {{ page.number }}
    • {% endif %} {%- endfor %} ``` At first glance, it looks quite harmless. However, when we dug into the implementation, we noticed the issue: ```python class Paginator def __iter__(self): self.__iter_page = 1 return self def next(self): page = self.page(self.__iter_page) self.__iter_page += 1 return page def page(self, page_number): page_number = self.validate_page_number(page_number) offset = (page_number - 1) * self.per_page_limit return Page(self.query_set.offset(offset).limit(self.per_page_limit).all(), # this is loading all of the results page_number, self) ``` The iterate is creating page objects and eagerly loading the all results into memory. The fix we put in place was to replace the loop with just a range of page numbers: ```python {%- for page_number in range(1, pagination.paginator.total_pages): %} {% if pagination.number == page_number %}
  • {{ page_number }} (current)
    • {% else %}
  • {{ page_number }}
    • {% endif %} {%- endfor %} ``` > I am really trying hard to improve my DoS testing methodologies and I believe I followed the best practices of testing for DoS, while finding and reporting this issue Thank you for improving your techniques, our team appreciates that you are changing your behavior, it helps a lot! Are you planning on writing up anything to help others in the community? I'd be happy to work with you if you would do so. > I also would like to ask if this report is eligible for a bounty & swag. Let me discuss with the team and I'll get back to you!

@bencode I would really like to help others in the community  , 
 can you please point me in the right direction , regarding how can i contribute in the community,  so far i am thinking to study , analyse and then write about bugbounty do's and don'ts or maybe some thing more focused on DoS attacks and report writing, but I am confused on what things should I mainly focus on while writing , i am also confused about choosing platform to write , should i write on medium or make github repo or write in a pdf 
your guidance and opinions will really be invaluable to me .
thank you
Thanks, @iamr000t! We truly appreciate how you have improved your DoS testing style on our assets. Keep up the good work and we hope that you'll continue to iterate on your methodology. Cheers!

As you saw above ☝️we decided to award a bounty-thanks!

your guidance and opinions will really be invaluable to me .
